    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRRotationByAxisAnimation

        public GVRRotationByAxisAnimation(GVRTransform target,
                                  float duration,
                                  float angle,
                                  float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float z)
        Use GVRTransform.rotateByAxis(float, float, float, float) to do an animated rotation about a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        target - GVRTransform to animate.
        duration - The animation duration, in seconds.
        angle - the rotation angle, in degrees
        x - the normalized axis x component
        y - the normalized axis y component
        z - the normalized axis z component

      • GVRRotationByAxisAnimation

        public GVRRotationByAxisAnimation(GVRSceneObject target,
                                  float duration,
                                  float angle,
                                  float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float z)
        Use GVRTransform.rotateByAxis(float, float, float, float) to do an animated rotation about a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        target - GVRSceneObject containing a GVRTransform
        duration - The animation duration, in seconds.
        angle - the rotation angle, in degrees
        x - the normalized axis x component
        y - the normalized axis y component
        z - the normalized axis z component

    • Method Detail

      • animate

        protected void animate(GVRHybridObject target,
                       float ratio)
        Description copied from class: GVRAnimation
        Override this to create a new animation. Generally, you do this by changing some property of the mTarget, and letting GVRF handle screen updates automatically.
        Specified by:
        animate in class GVRAnimation
        Parameters:
        target - The GVRF object to animate
        ratio - The start state is 0; the stop state is 1.
